creditline: Gift of Edith and Norman Garmezy
description: seated female nude in profile, with head turned to 3/4 view; another face in ULC
inscription:
Signature and Inscription

LRC, in pencil: [334]; LLC, in pencil: [7]; on back, in pencil: [50554 / FEMME NUE ASSISE] and [9445]
provenance: Edith and Norman Garmezy, Edina, MN; Garmezys acquired print from Gerhard Wurzer Gallery, Houston, in 1990
signed: LLC, in the image, in black: [Renoir]
text: Pierre Auguste Renoir was celebrated for his depictions of the female nude and explored this subject in various media.  He made this lithograph by drawing with a brush and diluted ink, capturing the soft contours of his model and enhancing the sensuality of his subject.
title: Study of a Seated Nude
